intro: Sedum kristenii, commonly known as the Kristensen's stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It features fleshy, upright stems and small, clustered leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in dry conditions. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the summer months, adding ornamental value to its habitat. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in its native range.
